title: Rate Increases in Brazil Seen Ending Soon as Inflation and Economy Slow
sub_head: Brazil’s 12-month inflation rate declined for the first time this year in May
body:
SÃO PAULO—Brazil’s central bank is likely to halt its 16-month cycle of interest rate increases after its policy meeting this week or at its following meeting as the higher cost of borrowing starts to reduce demand and slow the pace of consumer price increases, changing the medium-and long-term outlook for investors who have gotten used to rising rates.
